definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red

sentences.english: To engage in boisterous, drunken merrymaking.
sentences.chinese: 参加喧哗的畅饮的寻欢作乐。

sentences.english: Carrie had noticed the appearance of gayety and pleasure-seeking in the streets which they were following.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉注意到沿途那喜庆热闹和寻欢作乐的景象。
骑士们骑马比武，嬉戏作乐。

sentences.english: But the truth is there was no drunken carousing more honorable and fruitful.
sentences.chinese: 但是实际上，饮酒作乐实在是人生的一大快事。

sentences.english: This is referred to as the Confucian Road "music rituals" of the theme.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为儒家所称道的“制礼作乐”的主题思想。

sentences.english: Can only benefit from fairy who rave music.
sentences.chinese: 唯有一点好处是可以跟仙女们狂欢作乐。

sentences.english: It also clearly meant to have fun doing it.
sentences.chinese: 这个词同样也表示从中作乐。

sentences.english: Prince daily and ZhangLiHua flirting, bender.
sentences.chinese: 太子每日与张丽华打情骂俏，饮酒作乐。

sentences.english: From then on, the king of Qi gave up his bad habit of drinking and playing all night.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，齐威王改掉了整晚饮酒作乐的坏习惯。

sentences.english: His audience consists predominantly of groups of rugby-club revellers.
sentences.chinese: 他的观众主要是橄榄球俱乐部里那些纵酒作乐的人。

sentences.english: They were drinking and revelling all night.
These pleasure-seeking bohemians gave Reich pause.
sentences.chinese: 这样狂放不羁的寻欢作乐让赫希三思。
这是寻欢作乐的时代吗？

sentences.english: People are frantically looking for fun fixes, but that’s the law of diminishing returns.
sentences.chinese: 人们疯狂地寻欢作乐，但这就是报酬递减的规律。

sentences.english: In the eyes of pleasure-seekers, night is a good time for enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 在寻欢作乐的人的眼里，夜晚是享乐的大好时光。

sentences.english: The day was done, and the merrymakers had nearly all departed.
sentences.chinese: 一天已经过往，寻欢作乐的人们差未几全走光了。

definition: drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to perform music/to play a tune
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
